definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: He listened politely for ten minutes and then launched out.
sentences.chinese: 他彬彬有礼地听了十分钟，然后训起人来了。

sentences.english: Her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentences.chinese: 她那彬彬有礼的伪装开始露馅儿了。
听了这话，女推销员彬彬有礼地报以微笑。

sentences.english: He asked me politely for the book.
sentences.chinese: 他彬彬有礼地向我要那本书。

sentences.english: If I were you, I’d dress up and be well-mannered.
sentences.chinese: 如果我是你，我会穿正装并表现得彬彬有礼。

sentences.english: Exercise courtesy and tact at all times.
sentences.chinese: 总是练习着彬彬有礼且老成练达。

sentences.english: Theczarina was polite but was definitely not amused.
sentences.chinese: 女沙皇彬彬有礼，但无疑并不愉快。

sentences.english: You should always keep smiling, being polite when you talk with the interviewer.
sentences.chinese: 与面试官交谈时，你应彬彬有礼，始终面带微笑。

sentences.english: The people of this town are, for the most part, quiet and well-behaved.
sentences.chinese: 这个镇上的人大多温文尔雅，彬彬有礼。

sentences.english: If I were you, I'd dress up and be well-mannered.
sentences.chinese: 我是你，我会穿正装并得彬彬有礼。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there was a humble rabbit who had very good manners.
sentences.chinese: 从前有一只兔子，它非常谦虚，待人处世也彬彬有礼。

sentences.english: Money stripped off the veneer of good manners.
sentences.chinese: 金钱令他撕去了彬彬有礼的外表。

sentences.english: Everyone should be well-mannered at all times.
sentences.chinese: 大家都应该随时保持彬彬有礼的态度。

sentences.english: He is a docile and well-behaved child.
sentences.chinese: 他是个温顺且彬彬有礼的孩子。

sentences.english: Underneath his politeness, there was deceit and cunning.
sentences.chinese: 在他的彬彬有礼的伪装下，隐藏着欺诈和狡猾。

sentences.english: He made a very civil bow to me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我彬彬有礼地鞠了一躬。

definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
smiling wholeheartedly (idiom); beaming from ear to ear
neither haughty nor humble/neither overbearing nor servile/neither supercilious nor obsequious
neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
variant of 畢恭畢敬|毕恭毕敬[bi4 gong1 bi4 jing4]
(of one's conduct, speech etc) natural and unrestrained
